settings.title: All Knife Shapes
settings.content:
We have a knife designed for every kitchen job imaginable, from fine delicate cuts to chopping through bones. Many of our blades are traditional Japanese designs, while some are hybrids of Japanese and European styles, made with Japanese steels and techniques.

We also supplement the selection with some butchery knives from Spain and America, so you can find the exact blade that you're looking for. Whether you're looking for your first knife or your tenth, we've got the right one for you.

settings.title: Knife Sets
settings.text: Build yourself a matching set!

settings.title: Petty
settings.text: For small jobs, or if you just like a smaller knife.

settings.title: ko-Bunka
settings.text: The Ko Bunka is a smaller version of a Bunka. Any guesses on what “Ko” means in Japanese? You nailed it! It translates to “small.”

settings.title: Santoku
settings.text: Santoku means "three virtues". Slicing, dicing, chopping or meat, fish, veggies. This knife does it all.

settings.title: Can't figure out what's what?
settings.text: Read our Knife Knowledge 101: Knife Shapes & Uses

settings.title: Bunka
settings.text: Like a santoku, but like, more rock and roll.

settings.title: Kamagata
settings.text: Originally a shape meant for making shoes, but we use it on veggies.

settings.title: Nakiri
settings.text: This Japanese veggie knife is becoming a must for Western kitchens.

settings.title: Gyuto
settings.text: The classic chef's knife. Gyuto means "cow sword", cool huh?

settings.title: Kiritsuke
settings.text: Like a chef knife, but with more attitude and less rocking movement.

settings.title: Sujihiki
settings.text: When you need a nice long clean cut. Carving slabs of meat or trimming fish.

settings.title: Honesuki
settings.text: The definitive poultry deboning knife.

settings.title: Chuka Bocho
settings.text: For many classically trained Chinese chefs, these hefty blades are their chef's knife, performing nearly every kitchen task imaginable.

settings.title: Deba
settings.text: For filleting fish the Japanese way.

settings.title: Usuba
settings.text: A Japanese veggie knife for specialized jobs.

settings.title: Yanagiba
settings.text: The sushi chef's best friend.

settings.title: Bread knives
settings.text: Because pre-sliced bread is for the weak.

settings.title: Meat Cleaver
settings.text: For big heavy jobs, like going through joints and smaller bones.

settings.title: Boning Knives
settings.text: Find both Japanese style and more European style boning knives here.

settings.title: Cheese Knives
settings.text: Cheese, Gromit!

settings.title: Learn more about Japanese Knives and finding the right knife for you.
settings.content: We have a bunch of articles and resources for learning more about Japanese knives and how find the right one for you. As well as some general guides if you are new to all of this to get you started. You can find tons more information here at our blog as well.
